skill.name: Create New Skills
skill.description: Creates new Agent Skills for Claude Code following best practices and documentation. Use when the user wants to create a new skill, extend Claude's capabilities, or package domain expertise into a reusable skill.

skill.author: EGAdams

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation meta-skill containing no executable code, no network calls, no file writes, and no sensitive data access. Only reads its own documentation files to provide guidance on skill creation.

content.value_statement: Claude needs domain expertise to perform specialized tasks. This skill provides a step-by-step workflow for packaging your knowledge into reusable Agent Skills that Claude discovers and uses automatically. Transform general-purpose Claude into a specialist for your workflows.
actual_capabilities: Guides users through 8-step skill creation workflow
Creates SKILL.md files with YAML frontmatter and instructions
Teaches progressive disclosure architecture for efficient context usage
limitations: Does not execute code or run scripts directly
Only provides guidance, users must create files themselves
Focused on Claude Code only, not Claude.ai or API

use_cases.title: Package team workflows
use_cases.description: Capture team conventions and workflows into shared skills that every team member gets automatically via git.

use_cases.title: Share specialized knowledge
use_cases.description: Package domain expertise into skills that extend Claude with specialized capabilities for your industry.

use_cases.title: Build distributable skills
use_cases.description: Create skills bundled with plugins for distribution to other Claude Code users.

prompt_templates.title: New skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new skill called [skill-name] that [does what]. Where should I put the files and what structure should I use?

prompt_templates.title: Skill structure
prompt_templates.prompt: What are the required parts of a SKILL.md file? Explain the YAML frontmatter and body structure.

prompt_templates.title: With scripts
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a skill that includes a Python script. How do I reference the script from SKILL.md and make it executable?

prompt_templates.title: Multi-file
prompt_templates.prompt: My skill has too much content for one file. How do I split it into multiple files and use progressive disclosure?

output_examples.input: Create a skill that helps with Python code reviews
output: Step 2: Write SKILL.md with name, description, and allowed-tools (Read, Grep, Glob)
Step 3: Add instructions section with review workflow
Step 4: Add examples showing single file and multi-file review scenarios
Step 5: Test by asking Claude to review a Python file

best_practices: Include both what the skill does AND when to use it in the description for better discovery
Keep instructions focused under 5k tokens and split complex content into linked files
Use the allowed-tools field to restrict tool access for security-sensitive skills
anti_patterns: Using vague descriptions like 'helps with data' instead of specific use cases
Combining unrelated tasks into one skill instead of creating focused, composable skills
Putting all content in SKILL.md without using progressive disclosure for advanced topics

faq.question: What platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill creates skills for Claude Code. Pre-built Agent Skills work on Claude.ai and API, while custom skills are Claude Code specific.

faq.question: How many skills can I create?
faq.answer: There is no practical limit. Progressive disclosure means only relevant skill metadata loads at startup, keeping context efficient.

faq.question: Can I share skills with my team?
faq.answer: Yes. Project skills in .claude/skills/ are shared via git. Personal skills in ~/.claude/skills/ stay on your machine.

faq.question: Is this skill safe to use?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a documentation-only meta-skill that provides guidance without executing code or accessing sensitive data.

faq.question: Why is my skill not being used?
faq.answer: Check that the description is specific and includes trigger words. Verify YAML frontmatter is valid and file is in the correct location.

faq.question: How is this different from prompts?
faq.answer: Skills load on-demand and persist across sessions. Prompts are one-off instructions that must be repeated each conversation.
